Other Town / ashley-laurier
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:01 PM
Ashley woke up in her bed like any other morning.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:04 PM
She stretches and yawns, having had a great night's sleep last night. Getting up to put her clothes on, she realizes she forgot what day it is today, so she checks the calendar on her wall to see if it's a school day.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:06 PM
Today is Monday.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:07 PM
((What the fuck))
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:07 PM
((??????))
2:09 PM
Of course it’s also known fact that in other parts of the state today is Thursday. Something something timezones shut up
Ehn/PC
Today is Monday.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:12 PM
Ashley almost groans in disappointment. She'd been hoping it was the weekend still... but she silently chides herself for thinking that. After all, it's important that she goes to school and follows a healthy routine so that she doesn't cause trouble for her parents, even if she isn't a huge fan of school herself. And besides, all of her friends will be there anyways! With that cheering her up, she finishes putting her clothes on and checks her phone for any new notifications.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:15 PM
There are no new notifications.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:16 PM
She does her best impression of the emoji and leaves her room, heading to the kitchen for breakfast.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:19 PM
It would seem her parents are not awake yet. This is not particularly uncommon of an occurrence.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:22 PM
Oh well, she can make breakfast for herself. She starts making toast.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:25 PM
Nothing interrupts the ever important act of toasting bread.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:26 PM
Great! Peter Ashley has a normal breakfast.
2:28 PM
She checks her phone again while eating breakfast, just to make EXTRA SURE of any new notifications that might have popped up in the minutes between her getting dressed and preparing food.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:31 PM
There are still no new notifications. She's welcome to make her own though.
2:32 PM
Lilia entered the dining room. "Good morning, Ashley."
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:32 PM
"Good morning, mom!" Ashley smiles. "How'd you sleep?"
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 2:34 PM
"I slept good, thank you. How about you?" Umm actually it's slept 'well'.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 2:46 PM
"I slept well too! " She tries to think of anything else to say, but doesn't really know what to add after that. She goes back to finishing her breakfast and thinks of a really funny idea for a Twitter post, pulling out her phone again to tweet it.

She smiles to herself at the brilliance of this commentary on her favorite video game series.

Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 3:52 PM

Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 4:04 PM
Leaving the house, Ashley skips over to the bus stop and waits for the bus, listening to her playlist on her phone and not paying attention to her surroundings. She almost bumps into the stop sign at the end of the sidewalk, but saves herself from crashing into it at just the right time and turns it into a cool lean against the sign instead. (edited)
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 4:14 PM
Scrolling through more Twitter on her phone while waiting for the bus, she notices a GoFundMe post on the home page that one of her friends retweeted captioned "️DON'T SCROLL PAST UNLESS YOU'RE RACIST️ informational carrds about what's going on in the world right now! retweet to make your tl aware! worldissues.carrd.co". Ashley feels a twinge of guilt for not having noticed such a pressing matter before. Obviously she isn't racist, and helping out the less fortunate is the right thing to do, so she retweets it for her followers to see.

Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 6:10 PM
She starts glowing (metaphorical) with admiration at Autumn's words. Wow... Even on a dull Monday like this, she still takes the time out of her day to be considerate and helpful to those around her... I'm lucky to be friends with someone like her. She really is inspiring... Suddenly aware she's just been smiling for the past five seconds without responding, she starts blushing and looking away. "O-Oh, I'm doing well! I had a nice breakfast and a pretty normal morning, and uh, yeah..." she trails off.

Ashley sits one chair to the right of the chair directly behind Autumn. This foolproof strategy puts her not close enough to make it obvious that she's intentionally positioning herself near her, but also not far away enough to not be able to see or talk to her. She sits down and pretends to absentmindedly look the other way.

Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 7:06 PM
The teacher begins the lesson. "Russell Harry Coleman Green From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Jump to navigationJump to search Russell Harry Colman Green FRCCO (10 April 1908 – 6 February 1975) was an organist and composer based in England and Canada.[1] Contents 1 Life 2 Appointments 3 Compositions 4 References Life He was born in Norwich on 10 April 1908. He studied at the Birmingham School of Music and with G. D. Cunningham and Herbert Howells. He conducted the Olton Orchestra 1926–47, the Birmingham Festival Choral Society 1945–54, and the Russell Green Choir 1949–58. He moved to Ottawa, Canada in 1958 and died on 6 February 1975 in Saskatoon. Appointments Organist of St Bartholomew's Church, Edgbaston, Birmingham 1933–???? Organist of First Baptist Church (Ottawa) 1959–63 Dean of Music at Acadia University 1963–65 Organist at Knox United Church (Saskatoon) 1965–69 Organist at Christ Church, Saskatoon 1969–75 Compositions His compositions include over 350 songs, around 50 keyboard works, 50 sacred and secular choral pieces, a Paean for orchestra, and a cantata, Christus mediator (1962). References Who's who in music, Shaw Publishing, 1961 Categories: 1908 births1975 deathsEnglish organistsBritish male organistsEnglish emigrants to CanadaFellows of the Royal College of OrganistsMusicians from Norwich20th-century classical musicians20th-century English composers20th-century organists20th-century British male musicians" This ends the lesson and the school day.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 7:11 PM
As they're walking out of the classroom, Ashley waits for Aura so that she can ask a question: "Are our lessons always like that? Maybe I just wasn't paying attention the last time." She herself also attempts to remember if their lessons have been like this before today.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 7:14 PM
Of course. What method of learning could be better than reciting wikipedia articles verbatim? I certainly can't think of any, and the same goes for everyone else. Therefore it's simply logical to construct the entire curriculum out of reading wikipedia. "Nyeah?" Aura says this.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 7:22 PM
"Guess I should be focusing more on class then, huh." She shrugs her shoulders and lets the matter drop. "Oh yeah, by the way, have you heard of this game called Genshin Gay Baby Jail?"

"Well, I guess it wouldn't be TOO hard for me to figure out how to play myself. Still though, I thought it'd be nice to have some irl friends to play it with." She briefly wonders whether Autumn plays it, but doesn't want to bother her with a question like that. It's fine enough if she just plays it with her online friends- after all, nobody she knows in real life cares about Ace Attorney either, so it's not anything new.

Ashley pulls out her phone and looks Genshin up... nice, looks like it's available on mobile. She promptly presses the download button.

Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 8:01 PM
?! This will need to be investigated. Junie wouldn't recommend her a problematic game, would they...? She clicks on the results. (edited)
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 8:08 PM
According to these results, GGBJ is a gacha game. Meaning it relies on tricking minors into gambling with potentially real money for important things. Additionally, some results claim the game has whitewashed any character that should have been darker skinned.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 8:15 PM
Hm... Well, the first thing certainly doesn't sound good, but it's not the worst thing in the world either. She can play the game without choosing to spend money on it; she's a responsible person, even if others aren't as careful with their spending. The other thing, though, is more concerning. Maybe she can just pretend like she's not interested and not have to accuse Junie of anything? She doesn't want to believe that someone who's her friend would be problematic if she doesn't have to.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 8:20 PM
"Is something wrong, Ashley?" Autumn approached her.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 8:26 PM
"A-Ah, it's nothing... I was just looking up a game that I thought looked interesting. Have you heard of, uh, 'Genshin'...?" She mumbles this last part, a little embarrassed about it.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 8:27 PM
"I hear it’s fairly popular, but I’m not much of a gamer. Why?"
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 8:33 PM
"One of my online friends was asking me to play it with them, and I was just wondering if anyone I know in real life's played it since I've never played before."
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 8:37 PM
"Oh, I know some of our classmates that play it."
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 8:48 PM
"Wait, really? Which ones?"
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 8:50 PM
Autumn listed the names of 3 students. These are not any of the important characters.
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 8:59 PM
"Got it. I'll have to ask them about it, then. Thanks for the help! " Ashley probably wasn't going to ask any of them about it at all, given the discomforting things she'd just learned about it, but she was simply happy enough to have talked to Autumn at all that she viewed this conversation as rewarding in itself. It let her forget about things like Twitter discourse and problematic video games.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 9:02 PM
"It’s no problem. I live my life to help people. I couldn’t imagine someone not willing to even put in such a small effort to help you. Really, what I’ve done is simply the bare minimum."
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 9:14 PM
"Still, I'm grateful to have a friend like that. The way you live your life is so inspiring, you know? Someone who wants nothing more than to improve the world we all live in... The world needs people like that more than ever nowadays, and that's how I want to live my life too. It's why I look up to you." She's clearly embarrassed about saying this, but she manages to get out this sincere compliment.
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 9:16 PM
"Aww, you flatter me Ashley." She smiled. "It’s thanks to people like you that I can make it through every day motivated."
Ehn/PC 9/10/2022 9:45 PM
((I love never ending sessions. Unfortunately I’m going to cut it here we’ve reached the end of my allotted free time. 7 hours isn’t too bad for a first session probably))
Ashley Laurier 9/10/2022 9:54 PM
((Works for me. Good session))
Ehn/PC 9/12/2022 5:21 PM
((Saturday))
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:04 PM
"Aww, you flatter me Ashley." She smiled. "It’s thanks to people like you that I can make it through every day motivated."
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:08 PM
"L-Likewise," she stutters out. "Have a nice day!" While talking with Autumn was always a pleasure, Ashley needed to take a break from conversation with her at some point or else she'd die of embarrassment. She attempts to casually end the conversation there.
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:09 PM
"Alright, you too." Autumn left.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:18 PM
Ashley thought about what to do. After hearing about Genshin, she couldn't deny her interest was piqued. Her friend recommending it to her was a sign that it probably contained something of worth, but... the problematic aspect of it impeded this. She definitely couldn't go around asking other people about the game- in fact, even mentioning it to Autumn was a mistake, spurred on by the fact that she lost her ability to form coherent thoughts when Autumn was around. Sitting around and worrying about this hypothetical moral quandary wouldn't get her anywhere, though. Ashley needed to be able to confirm with her own eyes whether this game deserved to exist. Here's what she'd do. She'd go straight home, and if anyone asked about her day, she'd say it was just as normal and uneventful as any other. Nothing would be mentioned to any friends about this game. Then, she'd create an alternate account for herself to download the game under the guise of anonymity- of course, while locked in her room, to ensure complete secrecy and the lack of any observers. With this, Ashley would be able to judge Genshin Gay Baby Jail's value in complete isolation. She nods her head in response to her own thoughts, her plan fully formed.
2:18 PM
Therefore, she moves to exit the school building and head home. (edited)
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:20 PM
Aura is with her brother outside the entrance. You aren't required to see them or anything I'm just stating that they're there.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:24 PM
Moving quickly but discretely so as not to be discovered, Ashley hides behind the nearest corner or object that blocks her from being seen by the two. It's not strictly necessary to do this, she thinks, but it couldn't hurt to be extra cautious. After all, she'd told Aura earlier in the day that she was interested in Genshin as well, and if word got out about that from her, it could complicate things. She attempts to eavesdrop on their conversation to ensure that they aren't talking about her Genshin-related inquiry to Aura today.
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:28 PM
"Hey, what's wrong...?" Aura. Thomas responded by simply staring at her for a moment. "You don't get to ask that." "I dunno what you're talking about, nya!" Aura uncomfortably did her usual routine. Thomas just sighed in response. "Come on, let's go home." He grabbed her by the arm and tried to drag her away. "I dunno what you're talking about..." Aura tried to resist, but was ultimately weaker. She was dragged away.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:31 PM
Ashley exhales in relief. Neither of them seemed to be discussing Genshin, which increased the likelihood of her being in the clear. Satisfied with this, she resumes her walk home. Whatever was going on between her and her brother was probably just something trivial.
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:34 PM
Ashley arrived home.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:38 PM
Excellent. She swiftly walks towards her room, with the intent of immediately turning and locking her door behind her once she's inside (if there are no interruptions on the way there).
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:40 PM
This is uninterrupted.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:48 PM
All according to plan... Ashley closes the blinds and sits down in the middle of the floor in complete darkness with the light off. She turns on her phone and makes sure to turn off cloud sync, so that there won't be any lasting record of her activity saved in any backups after today. Then, she logs onto the app store with her alternate account she'd created for this very reason. If she had downloaded Genshin on her default account, even if she had deleted it and all associated data, it would still show up on the app store under the 'deleted apps' section for her to redownload. She couldn't risk leaving behind a trace like that under any circumstances. Having sufficiently protected herself from all possible negative outcomes, Ashley presses the 'download' button on Genshin Gay Baby Jail.
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:49 PM
The app will finish downloading in 1 hour.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 2:57 PM
WHAT? She didn't plan for such an unreasonable loading time... most apps only take 30 seconds maximum to download, don't they?! It's theoretically possible that she could just wait patiently for an hour, but wasting an hour of her valuable time like that was just out of the question. Maybe she should do something else while waiting... right, she should probably at least check on Aura to make sure everything is going well after that argument with her brother. Not like it'd be anything serious, but still, it's important to check on friends. Ashley pulls out her computer from her backpack and logs on using her default account. She sends a message to Aura reading "hey, how ya doin?"
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 2:59 PM
No response.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 3:00 PM
Hm. Does Aura usually respond quickly to messages like this?
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 3:05 PM
Yes.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 3:14 PM
Well, that makes this a little concerning. With Genshin needing an hour to download, maybe she can make a trip to her friend's house to make sure she's okay. Of course, she'd need to protect her phone to make sure that her download isn't discovered. She looks around her room…
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 3:15 PM
The download finished.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 3:20 PM
Oh wow, an hour passed already. Huh. …Still, Ashley has her mind made up to visit Aura's house. She can check out Genshin at any time, but her friend's situation is likely time-sensitive. Again, she looks around her room to find a way to protect her phone while she's out.
3:20 PM
((I need room decor for this plan to work. Can Ashley have a corkboard on her wall with various papers/posters pinned to it, as well as a tape dispenser in a drawer))
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 3:23 PM
((You can design your room yes))
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 3:30 PM
Awesome. Ashley unpins the various posters and papers from the corkboard, grabbing each of the thumbtacks she used to pin them up as she does so, and putting the papers and posters on her desk. She places her phone on her desk, opens the drawer, and takes out the tape dispenser, wrapping tape around her phone in various loops. Then, she attaches the thumbtacks to the tape, effectively creating a layer of spikes attached to her phone. Picking it up very carefully to avoid stabbing her hand, Ashley slides her phone underneath her bed. This way, anyone looking for her phone and sticking their hand under her bed to find it will find their hand stabbed by the thumbtacks and unable to grab at the phone- not unless they know specifically where to grab it, something they couldn't possibly see in the darkness under the bed. This way, only Ashley can reach under the bed and grab it, knowing specifically where she attached the thumbtacks in the first place.
3:32 PM
Her trap set, Ashley opens her blinds and puts on her backpack with computer inside. She exits her room and starts heading for Aura's house which is hopefully within walking distance.

Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 5:20 PM

Confused and upset, she just stands there, not knowing what to do. (edited)
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 5:35 PM

I'm sorry for coming over without letting you guys know, I just- I wanted to-" She stumbles on her own words, unable to get out what she's trying to say. (edited)
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 5:46 PM
"Who the hell do you think you are!?" Those were the first words he spoke.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 5:50 PM
Ashley recoils in shock again, too stunned to give an answer for half a second. "I'm... your sister's best friend, from school. We hang out all the time, so I thought it'd be fine if I came over to hang out... There's no way she hasn't told you about me, right...???"
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 6:03 PM
He lets her go when they reach the sidewalk. He stares at his hand for a moment. "Just get the hell out of here. Don’t come here again."
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 6:14 PM
At this, her confusion turns to frustration. "Can you at least tell me why not!? I get it, I came over without asking, I'm sorry. But what's going on here seems really weird to me! I've never seen Aura act like that, and now there's some issue with me ever coming over here at all?? Aura is my friend, and even if she wasn't, I'd still want to help anyone who seemed as upset as the way she was earlier. If there's any way I could help at all, I want to try my best at it! So could you just explain what's going on!?" (edited)
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 6:18 PM
He turned towards her, looked her right in the eye, and spoke. "You can’t do anything. You aren’t helping anyone, and you can’t help anyone."
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 6:24 PM
Ashley crosses her arms. "You're just saying that because you haven't been able to do anything yourself. If you think it's impossible to help someone in need, you're just not trying hard enough! It might seem hopeless now, but if someone I care about needs it, I will find a way to help them. All you're doing is just getting in my way with your negative attitude. People like you are why meaningful positive change never happens, even though it's always possible for things to get better!"
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 6:29 PM
He suddenly punches her in the face, his expression contorting into anger. After pulling his fist back, moved away from her, looking guilty. "You’re a child."
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 6:44 PM
Immediately, Ashley clutches at her face with one hand, almost falling over from the pain. "Wh... What the fuck is wrong with you?!" She came over to try to help his sister as best she could, and THIS is how he responds to it?! Is he fucking braindead??? No... no, that's not it. Of course; why hadn't she considered that before? Aura acting weird and scared like that, Thomas keeping watch on the front steps and taking her away from Aura when she was just trying to help, even that punch. That asswipe never cared for a second about Aura, or how to help her. He's the reason she needs help in the first place! "Fine then, jackass! See if I ever ask YOU for help again! And in case you didn't notice, Aurora is probably still miserable all alone back there, but it's clear you care more about beating some other 'child' who just wanted to talk to her than you care about the one crying in the backyard!" She spits in his face, then turns on her heel and storms off.

Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 7:40 PM
The story will randomly freeze for large amounts of levels to force you to grind extensively on daily quests. You cannot continue until you get to the necessary levels. It is possible to purchase tokens with ingame money, which can be used to spin for special characters but mostly new weapons. This is hard though, and you’re much more encouraged to spend real life money. No non-white characters appear in the time you play.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 7:41 PM
Ehn/PC 9/17/2022 7:51 PM
Extensive response.
Ashley Laurier 9/17/2022 7:53 PM
Ashley has had enough. She closes the obviously problematic game and deletes it from her phone, sighing in exhaustion. What an awful day... It would've been enough to not be able to do anything about her friend being abused by her brother, but now she has to figure out how to approach the troubling topic of someone who's supposed to be her friend recommending her a problematic game. Could this day get any worse?! She pins the posters and papers back up on her corkboard, throws away the tape, and opens her blinds back up. "Mari Rantasila From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Jump to navigationJump to search This biography of a living person needs additional citations for verification. Please help by adding reliable sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced must be removed immediately, especially if potentially libelous or harmful. Find sources: "Mari Rantasila" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR (November 2017) (Learn how and when to remove this template message) Mari Rantasila Mari Rantasila.jpg Rantasila in 2013 Born 7 January 1963 (age 59) Pori, Finland Other names Ritva Leena Mari Rantasila Occupation singer, actress, director Website www.marirantasila.com Ritva Leena Mari Rantasila (born 7 January 1963 in Pori, Finland)[1] is a Jussi Award-winning Finnish actress, director and singer. Contents 1 Career 2 Personal life 3 Filmography 3.1 Films 3.2 TV 4 Discography 4.1 Albums 4.2 Singles 4.3 Appearing on 5 References 6 External links"
Ehn/PC 10/1/2022 6:11 PM
"Career Rantasila studied as an actress at the Helsinki Theatre Academy, during which time Jouko Turkka was working as a teacher. Rantasila graduated with a master's degree in 1987. She is best known for acting in the TV series Raid (2000), in which she played the female lead, and Kotikatu (1995–2001, 2008–2009). In 2015 Rantasila acted in the Petri Kotwica film Henkesi edestä (Absolution). Rantasila became known as a singer in 1989 with the song "Auringossa" (In the Sun). In 2000, she sung the theme song of the TV series Raid, "Vain rakkaus" (Only Love). In 2000, she won the Best Female Soloist Emma prize. Rantasila has also worked as a songwriter since the disc Kaipuun kääntöpiiri. Markku Kanerva has also composed many of Rantasila's tracks. Rantasila has directed short films and three Risto the Rapper films: Ricky Rapper (2008) and the sequels Ricky Rapper and the Bicycle Thief (2010) and Risto Räppääjä and Villeä Venla (2012). In 2016, Rantasila won the Best Supporting Female Actress Jussi Award for her role in Henkesi edestä (2016).[2] Personal life Mari Rantasila's original name is Ritva Leena. She began using the name Mari as a 15-year old before changing it officially in the 1980s.[3] Rantasila's brother Juha Rantasila is a former professional ice hockey player.[4]"
6:11 PM

Ashley Laurier 10/8/2022 8:05 PM
Alright, easy enough. She was worried that they were going to ask her how her day was going, though as she goes to open the door to the garage, she realizes that it was a bit of an unrealistic expectation anyway. Works out nicely for her. She opens up one of the boxes in the garage, rifling through its contents until she can find a jump rope, which she promptly stuffs into her backpack. After this, she exits the garage and heads back inside. Ideally, she could simply grab everything she needed from the garage as well as from under the sink, but her parents would probably question her making multiple trips to the garage with different bags, and they'd definitely ask about what she was looking for underneath the sink. Hopefully she'll be able to get everything she needs tonight once her parents move to their bedroom, though she'll likely have to move more quietly at that point so that she doesn't wake them up. It shouldn't be too much of an issue, just a long wait. Then there's the matter of how to handle the operation itself. Is Thomas going to be waiting for her outside again? Hopefully not. The best case scenario is that he's inside the house, then answers her knock at the door, and she can catch him by surprise with the bowling ball. But if push comes to shove, she was able to sneak around him at his house before, so she could do it again if she really needed to. After knocking him out, the hard part is going to be dragging him to one of the rooms in the house. It's likely any room will do, though one with a lockable door and window would be an ideal setup, especially if it's low to the ground. He'll be tied up with the rope by then, so even if he wakes up, he won't be able to do much.
8:05 PM
From there, it's a simple process. Put on the gas mask, pour the mixture into the buckets. She probably won't have to bring many, but she should bring more than she thinks she needs just in case, especially if the room she has to work with is larger than expected. After that, with the door locked, all that'll be left is climbing out the window, shutting it as she goes. Again, being low to the ground is much better— she needs to be able to get back into the room somehow, and it'd be preferable to just climb back in and not have to break the lock on the door. Wait long enough, and then head back inside. Untie him and drag him out back. She'll find a tree with a branch to hang the rope from, tie it securely, and hang him from the other end. But disguising it isn't enough... she can't leave evidence behind. After arranging the body, she'll have to go back and dump the contents of the buckets somewhere in the woods. Spread it out so that it won't cause too much of a problem, and open the window so the gas dissipates from the room. After that, put the buckets back in the bag, and throw them away in the garbage somewhere. If all goes well, that should be the end of it. Yeah, the end of it...
Ehn/PC 10/8/2022 8:08 PM
((Holy shit))
Ashley Laurier 10/8/2022 8:08 PM

Ehn/PC 10/8/2022 8:08 PM

Ashley Laurier 10/8/2022 8:13 PM
The end of "it"? "Arranging the body"? Ashley starts sweating. She's not just talking about any normal plan here. Seriously, this is a murder plan... she's actually going to kill someone... She starts to bite her lip. That's not okay, right...?! Like, that's something that people go to jail for doing! There's no way she can do this to someone who... Well... No. The question isn't whether she "can" do this. She has to do this, for the sake of her best friend. If no one else can help Aura, she's going to do it. She has to be the person who looks out for her friends when they need her the most! Thomas has done nothing but hurt her and his sister. Who's going to miss someone like him? Aura won't. None of her friends will. It'll be over, and then they can return to things as usual, as best friends who don't have to worry about their home lives. That's what Aura wanted in the first place, right? So Ashley's doing a good thing. She just has to do this, and then everything can be fine afterwards. What's one day of hard work compared to the years of happiness she'll have with her besties afterwards? It's nothing, it doesn't matter at all! Everything will be alright, and Ashley will make sure it stays that way. She's going to save her friend's life.

Ashley Laurier 10/8/2022 9:21 PM
Hm. Ordinarily, she'd say something about this hashtag, but... multiple problems stand in the way of that. First of all, she doesn't want to start a Twitter debate at the moment, considering it'd take up way too much of her mental energy that she needs to conserve for her plan. More than that, though, the subject matter of the hashtag would be dangerous to involve herself with when she was already planning out her own crime. For this to work, she has to minimize her involvement in any kind of crime, even if it's just talking about it online. She sighs and stops looking at the hashtag, instead choosing to post about something else— her favorite game Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney. That'd calm her down.
Advehnt Guard
Online / twitter / ashleyyy✨💖
Ashley Laurier 10/8/2022 9:33 PM
@loveloveguilty: tbh i think part of the reason aa fans were so pissy about aa4 when it came out was because it didn't appeal to the kind of things the (cishet male) audience wanted out of aa at the time and it subverted those tropes in ways they didn't like and weren't ready for
9:33 PM
@loveloveguilty: apollo isn't a Badass who saves his assistant from being kidnapped, he's a nervous wreck who has to get pulled along by trucy because she's SMARTER and more resourceful than she is (anyone else remember the fakeout kidnapping from case 2?)

10:35 PM
((Saturday))
1
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 2:02 PM
"…Oh. Great. Well, your father’s here for you." He immediately leaves, satisfied.
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 2:52 PM
Ashley breathes a sigh of relief as her dad exits the room. She shouldn't have been so worried! If she keeps acting so nervous around the people who know her like that, she's going to let it slip that something's up. This should be thought of as just any other normal trip to a friend's house. "...Dad, wait," she calls out after him, almost instinctively. ...What?! What is she thinking?! She just successfully diverted attention away from herself to ensure her plan's success, and now her big, dumb mouth was calling after her dad for... for what? To tell him about what was going on? To let him know how she was really feeling? Ugh, how could she be so stupid?! She tries to nonchalantly cover up her words with a cough, praying that he didn't hear her.
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 2:55 PM
He stops for a moment. "Hm? Are you sick or something? We've got cough syrup in the kitchen."
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 2:58 PM
"A-Ah, thanks...! I'll go get some." She breathes another sigh of relief, internally this time, as she walks to the kitchen to look for the cough syrup. "Where is it again?"
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 3:00 PM
Her dad is gone. Her parents seem to have gone to bed now.
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 3:20 PM
...Thank goodness. Now she can get to work. Ashley returns to her room to get her travel bag, one in which she usually places clothes for going over to a friend's house, and walks back down to the kitchen. Instead of looking in the cabinets elsewhere, she immediately turns to the cabinet located under the sink. She pulls out the chemical bottles she'd been thinking of— three bottles of bleach, as well as three bottles of ammonia. To ensure these are kept safe, she places each bottle in its own plastic bag. Then, she places all of the plastic bags into the travel bag. Closing the cabinet under the sink, she makes one last trip to the garage to get the buckets she needs. She decides to take three. Placing each one inside of the next so as to not take up extra space in the travel bag, she takes out the plastic bags of bleach and ammonia, and puts them inside the buckets, then places the stack of buckets with the plastic bags inside it back in the bag. She zips up the bag. (edited)
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 3:30 PM
Should she go now, or wait for tomorrow...? She couldn't very well bring all this to school, so that'd be a hassle. But her plan might not work out at night if Thomas is asleep. Though... there'd be less potential witnesses, and furthermore, hiding the bags until tomorrow afternoon would be a challenge of its own. No, if she wanted to act, it would have to be tonight! Ashley opens one of the drawers to find a sticky note and a pen. On it, she writes:
I'm just out for a short walk before bed. Call me if you need me! -Ashley
She places this on the kitchen counter. After writing the note, she turns her phone's ringer off and places it in one of the kitchen's drawers. It wouldn't be good to worry her parents if they couldn't get ahold of her, but with any luck, they'd just think she didn't notice the call. And she didn't want her phone signal being traced to the Nielsens' house; that would be extremely bad. With everything set, Ashley prepares to head out the door. (edited)
3:33 PM
She looks around the house. Is there anything at this point that could stop her?
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 3:35 PM
Nothing.
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 3:37 PM
She leaves for Thomas Nielsen's house, shutting the door as quietly as she can.
3:39 PM
Is there anything to stop her on the way there?
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 3:40 PM
Nothing.
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 3:48 PM
Alright. She's at the door. She takes out the bowling ball from her backpack, clutching it with one hand, and takes out the jump rope with the other hand, setting it down on the porch outside the door. She looks around outside. She looks into the house through the windows. She looks at her own reflection in the glass. Her body starts shaking, slightly. She tries to calm it, but it doesn't work. There's absolutely nothing? No one around for her, no one to stop her at all? Why does she keep checking at this point? Nothing is going to come of it, but it almost feels like she needs to find someone. Her teachers aren't here to remind her to get a good night's sleep for school tomorrow, are they? Her parents aren't here to ask her what she's doing at a friend's house so late at night, are they? Autumn isn't here to calm her down and give her advice on what to do, is she? There's nobody to stop her now, is there? No one? Nothing? Absolutely, positively nothing?
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 3:49 PM
Nothing.
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 3:51 PM
… Ashley takes a deep, shuddering breath.
3:51 PM

"???" Quickly hiding the bowling ball behind her back, Ashley is stunned into silence for a moment. Who the fuck is this?? "Uh… hi. I, uh… I was just coming here to meet with a… a friend. Do you know if, uh…" Should I ask for Thomas? No, that would draw WAY too much attention, wouldn't it?? Am I dead in the water here??? No, no, think, there has to be a way out of this, there has to be a… "…Do you know if Autumn Peterson is here?"

Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 4:40 PM

Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 4:54 PM

Ashley's heart sinks into her stomach. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No, no, no, no, no, no... Fuck. Fuck!! What do I even do now?!! There's no more element of surprise, there's no plausible deniability here. He saw me, he saw me and now I don't have any way to save the plan... Of all fucking nights for someone else to answer the door, why tonight? And why their mom? How was I FUCKING stupid enough to not even consider this? What am I supposed to do now, what am I supposed to... She continues to stand there, the inside of her head becoming a cacophony of negativity so loud that she can barely make distinctions between her own individual thoughts anymore. There might as well be nothing going on around her.

Other Town / ashley-and-sam
Sam Kidink 10/15/2022 5:52 PM
[inner monologue, don't click until at least after session end] Okay, this girl doesn't seem to be part of the family. I don't think she's the 'Aura' mentioned by Autumn, but maybe I should ask anyway. What's she doing here, though? And Thomas is here as well, presumably talking to his mom. Could she be the person Thomas didn't want to see? That would be strange, she doesn't seem particularly threatening. But this entire situation probably poses no risk, so it definitely wouldn't hurt to ask. "...Oh, hi. I figured I'd stop by again. I got bored, sorry." Sam says this to Thomas in a fairly indifferent tone. "Who are you? Are you, uh, Aura, or someone else?" He asks Ashley this. ((credits: mvdy for the inner monologue system. really useful, now you can monologue in conversations)) (edited)
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 5:53 PM
((Wow that is genius))
5:56 PM
Ashley barely registers the voice coming from nearby. She takes a moment to process it before finally turning around, acknowledging its owner. "...No, sorry. Aura's inside. I'm just her friend from school! Who are you?"
Sam Kidink 10/15/2022 5:59 PM
...Wait, did I seriously never think to come up with a name since coming here? I have to plan these things out ahead of time, why didn't I think about this earlier? Did I really let my guard down so quickly? Well, anyway, uh... "School, huh? I suppose that makes sense. ...I'm Alex. What's your name? And what are you doing here, then?"
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 6:04 PM
"Well, if you don’t mind, could you take this conversation elsewhere?" The woman.
Sam Kidink 10/15/2022 6:08 PM
"Well, I was hoping to have a conversation with anyone in this house out of curiosity. Heard I'd find some interesting people here, but Thomas tried to chase me away last time. I didn't walk in on anything, did I? ...This is certainly the most that's happened all day." (edited)
Ehn/PC 10/15/2022 6:10 PM
"Oh, Thomas is so overdramatic. Teenagers, you know?" The woman. Thomas is just continuing to glare at Ashley.
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 6:12 PM
From the way he's talking about Thomas, he probably at least knows him to some extent. But I shouldn't assume he knows anything about me for now. What I should be most focused on at the moment is not digging myself into any deeper of a hole than I'm already in. I can agonize over my plan going wrong however much I want later, but for now I need to make sure that's the only thing that goes wrong for me tonight. Ashley tries to leave with all her belongings without saying anything to anyone. "Sorry, I wasn't even planning on being here tonight. I'm going to try to find my way to Autumn's house now. You have a good night, guys!" (edited)
Sam Kidink 10/15/2022 6:15 PM
Teenagers, right... drastic responses like his are definitely normal. What I'm hearing is that he probably has something going on. Maybe I'll talk to him later. Also, everyone really does know each other here. "Autumn's house? Oh, I'm currently staying over there. I suppose you are as well?"
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 6:21 PM
"Huh…?" Autumn's never mentioned this kid before. In fact, I've never seen him before. Why am I only finding this out now?? God, I just want to go home… I just want this to fucking stop already… "No, I'm… just a friend of hers. I was heading to her place to drop something off. Should I have met you before?"
Sam Kidink 10/15/2022 6:26 PM
Is it the right call to say that I'm new here? No, that would only give away information. If it comes up, it comes up, but if I'm going to be more careful, I shouldn't just leave clues behind. Anyway, I definitely want to know what's happening now, and Thomas seems like the best person to ask once that subsides. Well, I could also ask this girl. I don't know why she would be in such a hurry, and she hasn't even given her name, which I suppose I have to respect, but I doubt I'd get any useful information right now. "...Well, probably not. Anyway, have fun with that, I suppose."
Ashley Laurier 10/15/2022 6:30 PM
"Thanks!" She starts to walk away, then pauses. "Actually… Uh, would you mind if we met up again sometime in the future to talk about… stuff? I'm a little curious about you, if that's alright, I mean…"
Sam Kidink 10/15/2022 6:34 PM

Other Town / ashley-laurier
Ehn/PC 10/29/2022 2:06 PM
Ashley woke up in her bed the next morning.
Ashley Laurier 10/29/2022 2:39 PM
She wakes up with a dull, painful headache. Last night's sleep wasn't very restful. Quite the opposite– it was full of miserable nightmares. No matter how hard she thinks about them, though, they aren't anything other than an indistinct blur in her head, so she decides to stop. As soon as she loses that train of thought, memories of last night bubble up to the surface instead. Ugh, she'd probably have to check with her parents to check whether that priest mentioned anything about her little escapade, and if he did, how much of it needs to be brushed under the rug. And of course she had to schedule the meeting with Alex the day after... Even though she really didn't want to go... Thomas. Thomas Nielsen. How much does he know about what Ashley was doing? She feels like she's asked herself that question to herself at least fifty times since he saw her through the door at his house, but no matter how hard she tried to think about anything else, it just kept crawling back into her consciousness. If he really knew nothing, she could totally pass it off as a one-time thing and never take another shot at him, right? She could forget the Nielsens, forget all the drama, go back to her normal- No, no. No no no no no no no. What the fuck was she thinking? Not meeting up with Alex? Letting things go with Thomas? What kind of selfish, heartless, brainless stain on Earth would do something so idiotic? Her friend was still being abused, waiting helplessly for someone to rescue her, and here she was, trying to push that out of her life just to feel more comfortable? Just to feel more safe? She can't do that, she won't do that, she won't do it she won't do it she won't do it she won't do it she won't do it she won't. They need her. They need Ashley the good person, not Ashley the coward.
2:41 PM
She opens her phone, the light of the screen practically burning her eyes out of their sockets. What time is it, what day is it, any new notifications.

Ashley Laurier 10/30/2022 2:50 PM
Okay. She tries to take a few deep breaths. In... out... in... out... in... She covers her mouth with her hand and screams into it as loudly as she can, tears welling up in her eyes. Afterwards, she wipes her eyes with her sleeve while coughing as she walks back home. She can't remember the last time she asked either of her parents to drive her to school, but it's better than not going there at all, especially today.

"I'll keep that advice in mind, thanks. If Ashley is a good person, then in that case, I hope asking her questions isn't a problem?"

Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 7:45 PM
"Oh, I guess we should start now then." Ashley looks around. "Can we head to the room where you're staying here? It'd probably be better if we kept this conversation between the two of us."
Sam Kidink 11/12/2022 7:48 PM
"Sure." Sam goes up to the guest room and waits for Ashley to follow. Then, he shuts the door. "So, what did you want to talk about? If you're up for it, I still have my own questions, but you were the one who wanted to talk. This is probably what would've happened if things a few hours ago actually went normally."
Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 7:52 PM
"Haha, yeah..." she sighs. "I imagine both of our questions are about a similar topic, anyway. What I've wanted to know is, what kind of relationship did you have with Thomas Nielsen in the first place? When I first met you, you came off like you were already familiar with him in some way, but now you're the one asking me all of these questions about him. How much do you actually know about him and his family?"
Sam Kidink 11/12/2022 7:58 PM
"Well, that's an easy question. I know nothing. I walked up to Mrs. Peterson at some point and asked who she thought was 'interesting', and she pointed me in the direction of the Nielsens. Our relationship is me attempting to ask him questions and him refusing to answer any of them, which is quite annoying. So, if you know anything about him and his family, then I'm definitely curious."
Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 8:23 PM
"...Oh, I see. In that case, we're more or less in the same boat here." She crosses her arms and looks down at the floor wistfully. "Aura, his little sister, has been my- I mean... she was my friend for a long time. We'd hang out at school often and mess around together. It was nice, back then." "But a few days ago, I started to notice something was up with her. One day at school, I saw her brother dragging her home, and it looked like she really didn't want to go. So I thought, Aura's my friend, I should check up on her to make sure she's doing okay, right? I went over to her place to see how she was holding up..." "I didn't expect her to react the way she did at all. She started crying and yelling at me that I had to explain what I was doing there. That's when her damn brother, Thomas, came over and pulled me away from her. He told me to never come back to their house again." "I've never liked that guy, if I'm being honest. Maybe that's just petty of me... maybe I'm not a good person for thinking that... but I always thought there was something gross about him. And I was right. When I told him I just wanted to help my friend, who seemed like she was obviously really upset, he- he hit me." Ashley grimaces, her expression unstable. "That's when I knew he had to be the reason his sister was so upset. He kept trying to get me to stay away from her, to not look any further into anything, and it all pointed to him being the one abusing her and trying to keep me out of it."
8:23 PM
"Aura wouldn't tell me what was happening. Whenever I asked, she'd just avoid the subject. And I wanted to help her more than anything! I wanted things to go back to how they were before. So I asked Autumn what I could do to help her, but Autumn told me that- that she..." Ashley starts trembling a little bit again, the same way as she did earlier this afternoon. "Autumn said that Aura was never being abused. That both her and the police had looked into it already, and they found out that Aura was just making everything up to get attention instead of having any real problem. I guess Aura admitted to that today, too..." She hangs her head. "I didn't want to believe it. Honestly, there's a part of me that still doesn't. So I went to Thomas's house that night to try and... well... you know. I thought I could save her. But then their mom was at the door instead, and you showed up too. I missed my chance." "After that... I'm pretty sure you know the rest. I went to meet up with you. I was trying to find out anything from you that could help me get the upper hand on him. It's funny," she laughs in a self-mocking tone, "I wouldn't have found out anything useful anyways. And now Aura isn't my friend anymore. She's back at home with Thomas, probably. I still don't know whether to believe her about her having made everything up, you know? Right now, I feel like it's easier to just not think about it. I guess in a way, I gave up on her. Does that really make me a better person...?"
8:23 PM
Ashley falls silent.
Sam Kidink 11/12/2022 8:51 PM
Sam walks around for a little bit in circles for a little bit and starts thinking. If Thomas had a reputation in the past according to Mrs. Peterson, but Aura was more 'normal', yet everything has suddenly changed in the past few days, what could even be the reason? Was I wrong? Perhaps everyone was nice to each other at some point, but then issues started coming up. But there's no clear origin to any of this, is there? Maybe it was never meant to make sense. After that, he finally speaks up. "...From Thomas' refusal to tell me anything, I can see why you might not have liked him. And if he hit you, he's certainly open to crossing some boundaries which shouldn't be crossed. However, none of Aura's actions make sense to me either, though. It felt like she was an entirely different person in the two seconds she talked to you compared to the entire rest of that meeting, and if what you say is true, then when she was being dragged back earlier, history really was repeating itself. Plus, I have no idea why she would be making up anything, if at all." "Personally, I'd just say it's all incomprehensible and I would just give up on thinking about any of it. My best guess is that because she doesn't like being at home that one or both of her parents are up to something. If Thomas is at fault, that doesn't just come out of nowhere. But that's all I can reason through. Her actions are ultimately nonsense, and if such a person tried to come close to me, I'd avoid them." (edited)
8:51 PM
"How I see this is that sometimes you end up giving up. Maybe it doesn't make you a better person, but perhaps what happened really was necessary in the end. I understand that you were friends in the past, though, so it's difficult to move on. And I don't think the decision to move on or keep trying your way through an important event is particularly good or bad. What makes a choice valuable is not what the successful choice was. It's the approach." He sighs. "I've failed in the past - to help someone out - and it's surprising that I even got out of it safely myself, but I left people behind as a result. It's as I said earlier. I don't care much about being a good person, and me being here in the first place is a consequence of that, good or bad. ...While none of this is very personal to me, it is to you, so you should be careful about taking unnecessary risks. Make sure you understand as much as possible first." "...Well, anyway. Perhaps I've been talking for too long. What do you think?"
Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 9:19 PM
Ashley stares at him a little incredulously. "I really don't get you. Maybe her actions were hard to figure out, I'll admit that much. But that's exactly why I feel like I needed to help her instead of just ignoring the issue. If someone's suffering, you don't just toss them aside because you can't understand why." She crosses her arms, now annoyed. "It might be easier to just give up thinking about it because it's difficult to understand. But I don't want to just take whatever's the easiest way out! Your excuses to not care about people might work for you because you don't think it matters to be a good person, but it does. And I hate myself for being so passive like this! The only reason I stopped trying to help her is because I'm not sure whether she deserves it anymore. That's got nothing to do with your noncommittal attitude towards your morals." Having said this, she pauses. "...You did help me realize what I should be doing, though. Instead of just standing around here feeling sorry for myself, I should be trying to find out for sure whether she really is a bad person. Thanks for that."
Sam Kidink 11/12/2022 9:28 PM
"See, that's my solution, but it's also the problem. I don't actually know people here that well. It makes it easy to simply look at things from the perspective of whatever seems enjoyable, because if it goes wrong, it's technically not my problem. I don't like making things my problem, and if it's unnecessary to get to know someone, then I won't." "However, you know Aura, and you probably did - have? - for years. So, I imagine it should be much easier for you to have a chance at understanding what she's doing. And if you think it matters to be a good person, then I suppose it makes sense for you to have that goal. I think it's good to understand what's going on. I'm sure at least part of her wants you to figure this out if you put your mind to it." "How did you two become friends initially? That could help you figure out what might've changed. ...And, perhaps more importantly, let's say you find out she's not a bad person. Does that necessarily make her good, and what would you do then?"
9:30 PM
Actually, is it really a problem at all? It works for me. But her perspective is definitely different, so I suppose it's fine to approach things this way.
Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 9:50 PM
"If I find out she's not a bad person... well..." Ashley hadn't really considered that. "I'll cross that bridge when I come to it, I guess. no use worrying about it right now when I still don't think there's enough proof in either direction. Thanks for the advice otherwise, though." "...And by the way, I really don't think the way you think is healthy. Right now you don't seem like a bad person, but being so uncritical of the world around you is a real easy way to become one. If you keep avoiding things because they think they're 'not your problem', one day you're going to find out that they actually are, and that day won't be a very happy one."
Sam Kidink 11/12/2022 10:03 PM
I guess I won't get an answer to 'how they became friends initially'. I don't know what I would use that information for anyway. "Well, there are things I am critical of, and I'm sure you have an idea of some of them. However, Autumn seems to think of being good as based on what you do. If you don't do anything bad, then can you really be a bad person? I don't know what you think being a good person means, but I assume it's similar." "...I'd be quite surprised if any of this ends up being my problem, but if it does, then I hope that day doesn't come. But I've found ways around that in the past, so I'd like to think I would be able to still. Well, I'm glad you consider me not to be bad for now, even if it's not a way I would approach things. And as I said, I hope to still be active in this situation, whether it's my problem or not."
Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 10:13 PM
She frowns at his words, opening her mouth to say something multiple times before closing it again each time. Finally, she simply says, "Did you have anything else you want to ask me?"
Sam Kidink 11/12/2022 10:19 PM
Well, that was a good conversation. I'd try to continue it, but I don't have any good follow-ups. I'll just move on. "Maybe I'm overcomplicating this, sorry. Anyway, I have one more question, though it's completely unrelated. Autumn mentioned before about you being active online, I think...? What do you do there?"
Ashley Laurier 11/12/2022 10:23 PM

Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 4:58 PM
"That's good! I'm doing pretty well too, haha." How should I say it? Should I just come right out and ask her? Do I wait for the conversation to turn in that direction? Ughhh, this is hard… "Thanks for… letting me stay here, by the way. I know it wasn't what you wanted to happen, but I just really needed to talk to you alone. I wanted to ask you some stuff, and tell you something that… well, I just didn't want it to be overheard at school, you know…?"
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 4:59 PM
"I understand. Go ahead."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 5:18 PM
"F-First of all, uh… This might sound like a dumb question, but I've been thinking about this a lot." She swallows. "You know, for all of my life, I've been trying to be a good person for the sake of those around me. The world needs more people like that, I think– people willing to step up and do the right thing in a world where most just look on and let terrible things happen all around them. So I've always tried to lend a hand to those who've needed it, to help people with no one else on their side, because I was sure it was the right way to live my life." Her expression darkens. "But… well, you were there for a lot of it, so I don't need to explain it again to you, but it turned out that trying to help my best friend was the wrong thing to do. I thought I was being good by helping her out, but I see now that all I was doing was enabling bad things. I… don't want to make a mistake like that again. But I don't know how not to!" She raises her voice without meaning to. "When I saw Aura like that, I didn't doubt for a second that she needed my help. I kept thinking that it would be- that it'd be wrong not to help her. And… I'm worried that if I keep going like this, I'll let something like that happen again." Ashley looks up at Autumn with pleading eyes. "That's why I want you to tell me… What does being a good person mean to you? What makes someone a bad person? How do I tell the difference? I… I tried talking to Alex about it, but he just made everything more confusing. So I need you to tell me… What should I do?" (edited)
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 5:24 PM
"That’s the kind of thing a good person knows intuitively." She smiled kindly. "But if you want my advice, you should avoid listening Alex's words. Those kinds of people are dangerous to your young and impressionable mind."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 5:29 PM
"..." Ashley looks away, trying not to let the pain and frustration on her face show. She just wanted a clear-cut answer. She just wanted to know how to do the right thing! So why...?! "I... Alright. Thanks for the advice."
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 5:31 PM
"If you’re lost, you can always ask me for advice. I don’t make mistakes like that. But of course, as a good person too, you probably wouldn’t need my advice. Right?"
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 5:37 PM
"Yeah. You're right." She hardens her expression and nods. "I had one other question I wanted to ask, not for advice, but just out of curiosity." Crossing her arms, she asks, "Do you think that, if they try hard enough, a bad person can become good again?"
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:03 PM
"That’s a strange question."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 6:08 PM
"..."
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:09 PM

Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 6:10 PM

Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:13 PM
"If you really want to know my thoughts, I don’t think a bad person can so easily become a good one. What made them a bad person in the first place? That doesn’t go away just like that. It’s a fundamental problem with them."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 6:20 PM

Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:23 PM

Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 6:40 PM

Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:41 PM

Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:44 PM

Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 6:50 PM

She stumbles over her words again. "I just... I think you're a really nice person! And whenever I'm around you, my heart feels like it's going to burst out of my chest! And when I talk to you, I start feeling like nothing else matters! I feel like I could just listen to you talk forever and that would be enough for me... So... What I'm trying to say is that, um, I really, really love you. And, only if it's okay with you of course, would it be fine if uh, I could... be your girlfriend...?"
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 6:52 PM
Her smile didn’t waver at all. "Of course not."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 7:01 PM
Ashley tries to stifle a rapid intake of breath. She stands completely still, even though it feels like she's just been stabbed through the heart. It takes a few seconds for her to find words again. "...R-Right, of course! I'm, I'm sorry for suggesting it– I didn't think that- No, that doesn't matter. I..." she takes a deep breath. "Our friendship comes first. Just- Just forget I said that. I'm... sorry if it makes things any more awkward between us, I didn't mean to..." (edited)
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 7:04 PM
"…At least not yet."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 7:05 PM
"Y-Yet?" In spite of itself, Ashley's heart is filled with a sudden surge of something resembling hope. "What... What do you mean?"
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 7:08 PM
"If you’re a good, obedient, friend… Maybe I could reconsider. Just don’t go ignoring my advice like last time." (edited)
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 7:27 PM
She tenses up at this. It was because she wasn't a good enough friend…? She hadn't even considered that before, but it did make enough sense… she'd been so disconnected from being a good person that she'd asked for an explanation of how to be one. It's completely reasonable why Autumn wouldn't want to go out with someone like her, the way she is right now. "I understand… yeah. I'm sorry for being so stubborn about listening to you last time. It won't happen again."
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 7:27 PM
"I’m glad to hear that."
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 7:37 PM

Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 8:59 PM
Ashley nods. "Yeah, absolutely. It's not a problem at all."
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 9:00 PM
"You’re off to a great start."
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 9:05 PM
She grins in satisfaction. At least she's on the road to being a better friend now, despite a rough past couple of days.
Ehn/PC 11/19/2022 9:07 PM
Autumn got into bed.
Ashley Laurier 11/19/2022 9:10 PM
Ashley curled up on the floor, still smiling to herself even despite her discomfort- she could handle it, after all, so it didn't even warrant a thought. As she tried to force herself to fall asleep, she thought about how incredibly lucky she was.

Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 2:48 PM

Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 2:55 PM
She smiles warmly at confirming her friend's presence, walking up to Autumn in the kitchen. "Good morniiing~! Man, that looks tasty." For a brief moment, Ashley is caught in the fantasy of a moment like this. Waking up in Autumn's house, coming downstairs to breakfast… She shakes the thought out of her head as she blushes. If she's going to fantasize about that, she'd have to earn it. No use thinking about that kind of thing now when she hasn't even proven her worth as a friend yet.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:02 PM
"Good morning!" Autumn's smile was much brighter this morning than the one that usually stuck to her face.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 3:08 PM
"Wow, you look happy today." Seeing her like that, Ashley feels like her entire day's been made, too. "Something goin' on?" (edited)
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:14 PM
"I’m just happy to be with you, Ashley." Autumn finished preparing breakfast, and put the plates down at their seats.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 3:18 PM
These words almost knock Ashley over with their weight. Trying not to let Autumn see it, she puts a hand to her chest and feels her heart pounding. "Ah... I'm happy to be with you too, Autumn." She practically staggers over to the breakfast table. (edited)
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:20 PM
Autumn took a seat as well. "Here’s to another beautiful day."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 3:23 PM
"Cheers to that! ️"
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:29 PM
She starts eating. "Do you like it? I came up with the recipe by myself ."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 3:32 PM
Ashley takes a bite. How does it taste?
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:34 PM
It’s great. How could it not be?
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 3:36 PM
True!
3:39 PM
"It tastes amazing! You really outdid yourself this time, hehe." She's enjoying the meal so much that this sentence comes through a mouthful of food.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:41 PM
"Thank you! I’m so glad you like it. I made it just for you."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 3:46 PM
Ashley can barely believe what she's hearing. This has to be, like, a test of some kind, right? "Ahaha, you really don't have to say that. It's nice enough I get to just exist around you, really…" She lets out a happy sigh. "Having you do things for me like that would be more than I deserve." (edited)
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 3:51 PM
"You existing around me helps me a lot too. You’re a really great person to have that kind of automatically soothing presence."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:00 PM
"Well, if anything I do can help you in any way, that's all I could want." She's practically glowing with happiness from all these unexpected compliments. "And that 'automatically soothing presence' goes twofold for you, of course... You're like the perfect version of me."
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:04 PM
"I didn’t know most people dated themselves."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:22 PM
"Ah- n-no, I meant-!" She blushes fiercely, almost too flustered to even question whether it's okay to say she's dating Autumn. "You're just... I can't imagine ever meeting someone else as kind-hearted as you, as pretty as you, as flawless as you. After my last friend group, I just- I thought I'd never have friends again. I thought I didn't deserve it... I'm still not sure if I do." Why is she saying all this? She can't really tell, but she continues. "I'm luckier than any girl in the world that I met you, who showed me how to be a good person. It seems to come to you so naturally, and I... I guess I wish I could be like that. I wish I could be like you."
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:26 PM
"I'm really glad to know you think so highly of me. Helping people is my specialty, after all. And I know it can be your specialty too."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:27 PM
"...I hope so, yeah." Ashley gives an awkward, but still genuine smile.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:28 PM
"Do you?"
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:36 PM
"It's the way I provide value to this world, after all! If I wasn't helping people, why else would I be alive?"
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:36 PM
"But do you want it to be that way? Wouldn't you rather have me do everything for you?"
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:41 PM
"Well... even if I did, would it really matter if I wanted something like that? That's just me being selfish. I know better than to act on that feeling." (edited)
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:45 PM
"But if you could pretend. Just for a moment. In the comfort of your own mind. You still wouldn't do it then?"
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:47 PM
"I guess... maybe I would..." (edited)
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:50 PM
"Do you want to pretend right now?"
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 4:53 PM
She's nearly speechless, her entire face red from embarrassment. ".....I do."
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 4:55 PM
Autumn reaches out her hand for Ashley to take it. "Then Ashley Laurier, will you marry me?"
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 5:06 PM
Ashley can feel tears welling up in her eyes. "I... Yes...! Oh my god, yes, I will! I love you so much...!"
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 5:18 PM
Between Ashley's blinks, the world seemed to change around them. She found herself in a large wedding hall, filled with everyone she could remember. They all cheered for her. She could even catch her parents yelling "We're so proud of you, Ashley!" Ashley's clothes had become a white wedding dress, while Autumn now wore a tuxedo. For some reason, Autumn held a kid's leash attached to Ashley, but at a reasonable size for Ashley's age. ((These fucking things. Evil contraptions))
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 5:36 PM
Ashley can still feel the tears of joy running down her face. "I- I didn't think this would ever happen... Thank you for letting someone like me be happy. For making my dreams come true." Her expression is alight with the purest happiness she feels she's ever known.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 5:47 PM
"Well, my goal has always been to help people. Even if it’s someone like you." Autumn drags her to the actual spot where they’re wed. Sam Kidink is officiating.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 5:50 PM
She's pleasantly surprised to see Alex here, but it makes enough sense. She gives a little wave to him.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 5:53 PM
Autumn gives large waves to the crowd of attendees.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 6:30 PM
Eventually everything quiets down, and Autumn turns to Ashley with a gentle smile. "When I first saw you, I saw an aimless nobody who was too pathetic to do anything right." There’s an uncomfortable pause. "But I'm glad I saw through that though, because underneath that is a person who I know will keep trying her hardest to improve every day. Someone who will work however much she needs to to make everyone around her live happier and more full lives despite her own imperfections. …And I'm lucky to have someone so dedicated to my happiness. I promise to keep seeing the good in you. And to let you keep believing you're better than you've convinced yourself you are. …Because spending that time helping you you will make my life that much better." Before Ashley can speak, she adds the following. "From the moment you laid eyes on me you knew I was a beautiful, intelligent, capable …and most of all, good person. You’re incredibly lucky to have someone as incredible me you in your life… Because I light up even the darkest days and make you feel like you can be the best version of yourself there is. And you promise to keep trying to be the best version of you you can, so that every day you can give me back even a little of the light I’ve given you."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 6:35 PM
Ashley nods happily. She doesn't need to say anything further- Autumn already put it perfectly.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 6:39 PM
Sam speaks. "Do you, Autumn Peterson, take Ashley Laurier to be your lawfully wedded wife? Told have and to hold from this day forward, for better, for worse, for richer, for poorer, in sickness and health, until death do you part?" "I do." Autumn. "Do you, Ashley Laurier, take Autumn Peterson to be your lawfully wedded wife? Told have and to hold from this day forward, for better, for worse, for richer, for poorer, in sickness and health, until death do you part?" Sam. "She does not." Autumn.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 6:45 PM
"...?" For the first time, Ashley looks confused. Is this part of what's supposed to happen? She wants to open her mouth to speak, but she's not sure she should interrupt this; Autumn probably knows what she's doing, and it might be impolite to assume otherwise.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 6:58 PM
Everyone acts like this is normal. Honestly, I can't say that I know whether this is abnormal either. Of course I understand the vague notion of a wedding. A legally binding union that promises 2 people are closer than any other. But what does it even amount to? Vague promises and the like, is anyone expecting these things to last? Why do they believe in them? Because it's the law? That doesn't make much sense. What can the law do for people? How can it judge the bonds between them? And of course divorce exists. I've witnessed it myself, 2 humans being torn apart while begging each other to believe their original union held any meaning. Why did they get married in the first place? I would've liked to know that. Some understanding of the value they found in this ritual. Some understanding of what even happened when they came together. What broke between them? Was it me? The vows mention many things, but children don't come up. I've never seen children come up. Did my existence destroy them? I'd like to think not. But you don't understand weddings either, do you Ashley? Your parents, they married, why did they not tell you anything of it. Why is this fantasy you're living out so... Unrealistic? In the end, even after all that self-inflicted nostalgic misery, all I can feel is pity for you. Why is this the life of Ashley Laurier? I'm sorry. …I know my words ring meaningless, you can't hear what I have to say. In these words, there is barely a single concrete description of anything you perceive. Your eyes, your ears, your senses, none are tuned to perceive emotion. My emotion. Should I convey these words to you? Would this hold any more meaning if you heard it? Is a confession without context or reason more meaningful than a confession to no one? I don't believe so. My words, my apology, they bare no meaning to this brief happy illusion. You have no need for my pity, Ashley Laurier. But I'm sorry nonetheless.
6:59 PM
"You may now kiss the bride." Sam Kidink. Autumn lifts up Ashley's veil, and kisses her.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 7:19 PM
Ashley's still confused, but she just lets herself melt into the feeling. She doesn't need to think about it too hard, really. It's easier not to, and she wouldn't ruin this moment for the world by thinking too hard. To her, this is everything she's ever wanted.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 7:20 PM
Autumn embraces Ashley tightly as they kiss.
7:27 PM
"I love you, Ashley."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 7:31 PM
Ashley holds her just as tightly, as if holding on for dear life to something she never wants to let go. "I love you too, Autumn... you're everything to me..."
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 7:33 PM
"I'll be with you forever, okay? Let your worries melt away. I'll take care of everything."
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 7:34 PM
"Okay..."
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 7:42 PM
Their surroundings seemed to melt away. Like all that was left was the 2 of them, orbiting each other like planets in an endless sky. "Isn't this beautiful?" Autumn's cheeks turned a bright red. "Does it really matter what happens to anyone else in this world when we have each other?"
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 7:52 PM
The words almost make Ashley feel sad, like she's forgetting about something important. But no answer other than 'yes' comes to mind in the end. In fact, she doesn't even get out a 'yes'. She simply wordlessly nods her head.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 7:59 PM
"Let's stay here forever. Here... Where the world can never reach us. Here, where you can be happy. Even if you might not deserve it." The universe continued to weigh down upon them, but it no longer felt like a burden. It was a comforting blanket, like a shield that kept them together and blocked everything else from harming them. This thought produced a strange sensation in Ashley. An awareness that she wore no such blanket. In fact, unlike the sweet gentle embrace of Autumn she'd experienced so soon before, the world below her was cold and hard. Like laying on the filthy floor where Ashley felt she really belonged. (edited)
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 8:33 PM
Ashley slowly tore her eyes open, like she was ripping off a band-aid. She looked around and let out a sigh, just as she had in her dream. This was the world she knew. What a relief... she's embarrassed she chose to stay in that disgusting nightmare for so long. There's no use in running from reality. Somehow, she's going to have to get that through her own thick skull.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 8:34 PM
It's a little before midnight. Autumn seems to be still asleep.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 8:46 PM
Huh, she hadn't expected herself to wake up this early. Was sleeping on the floor such a good idea after all...? Obviously, it'd be ridiculous to expect Autumn to share her bed, but she'd probably need a more comfortable place to stay if she wanted to get a remotely healthy amount of rest. She gets up and heads for the door. And then she looks back at Autumn. Still sleeping there, comfy and pretty as she is, probably never having had to worry about her own morality in her life. Of course it'd come naturally to her. Of course she'd just expect everyone else to figure it out. If she just- if she just thought about how it felt to be anyone other than herself, maybe she'd... Ashley's thoughts slow to a halt, suddenly shocked at her own feelings. Where is this coming from? Why is she so angry at Autumn, who's done nothing but be hospitable and try to help her, if a bit distant? ...Maybe she really is ungrateful. She moves to exit the room before she can think about it any longer.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 8:47 PM
The house is silent.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 8:50 PM
Despite Autumn's earlier warning, Ashley tries heading to the room Sam was staying in and opening the door.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 8:51 PM
He’s asleep.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 8:53 PM
Damn. She was secretly hoping he wouldn't be back here so she could steal the spot where he was sleeping. Any couch/sofa in the house? (edited)
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 8:53 PM
There’s a couch in the living room.
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 8:54 PM
Rubbing at her eyes, Ashley closes Sam's door as silently as possible and trudges over to the living room couch, practically collapsing onto it.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 8:57 PM
Does she go to sleep?
Ashley Laurier 12/3/2022 8:58 PM
She can't really think of anything better to do, and she's both physically and emotionally exhausted, so yeah.
Ehn/PC 12/3/2022 8:58 PM
((The chapter ends))
